value.title: The CustomData feature is now generally available in Power BI!
value.excerpt: The capability to pass custom data for row level security is now available in Power BI Premium, Power BI Embedded, and Power BI Premium per User.

value.title: Announcing: The Power BI app for Microsoft Teams is now available in the US Government Community cloud
value.excerpt: We’re excited to announce the Power BI app for Microsoft Teams is available in the US Government Community clouds (GCC). This enables organizations in GCC to use Power BI as a data hub, enables users to find data without context switches, and to bring data into more collaboration to help make better

value.title: Visualize your data quickly from Power Apps and Dynamics 365 apps (preview)
value.excerpt: We’re very excited to announce a new way to visualize your model-driven Power Apps and Dynamics 365 data stored within Dataverse. value.title: Power BI Streaming Dataflows November Update
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce new capabilities for Streaming Dataflows in Power BI.

value.title: Announcing Power BI APIs .NET SDK v4
value.excerpt:
We are thrilled to announce the release of Power BI APIs .NET SDK v4.

The new SDK version provides clarity on the properties of Power BI artifacts returned by various APIs and makes it easier to use them,

value.title: Create Connected PivotTables in Excel for the web
value.excerpt: You can now create reports connected to Power BI datasets from a blank workbook in Excel for the web.

value.title: Capacity settings for datasets are now in Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: Capacity settings for datasets now in Power BI Premium Gen 2!

value.title: Announcing Power BI integration with Databricks Partner Connect
value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop customers can now visualize data in their Delta Lake using Databricks with just a couple of clicks. In the past, connecting to Databricks from Power BI Desktop required the end user to perform a lot of manual configuration. Power BI Desktop integration with Databricks Partner Connect

value.title: Power BI bolsters Azure AS compatibility with EffectiveUserName support
value.excerpt: We are announcing support for user impersonation using the EffectiveUserName connection-string property. This is truly exciting because it opens the door for mass migrations of tabular Analysis Services solutions that rely on EffectiveUserName-based impersonation to Power BI. It also opens new options

value.title: Export to Excel Improvements for Table and Matrix Visuals (Preview)
value.excerpt: We’re excited to announce enhancements to the export to Excel experience. Read this blog to learn how these changes help more Excel users use data from Power BI to make decisions.

value.title: Power BI November 2021 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: Welcome to the November 2021 update. The team has been hard at work delivering mighty features before the year ends and we are thrilled to release new format pane preview feature, page and bookmark navigators, new text box formatting options, pie, and donut chart rotation. There is more to explore, please

value.title: Introducing the New Format Pane (Preview)
value.excerpt: We’ve heard your feedback and would like to introduce you to the redesigned format pane! In this blog post you’ll find the biggest changes we’ve made to improve the usability and consistency across visuals and non-visual elements.

value.title: Power BI Update - November 2021
value.excerpt: Welcome to the November 2021 update.  Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/mspowerbi  More questions? Try asking the Power BI Community @ https://community.powerbi.com/ #PowerBI #Microsoft

value.title: Create a more Data Driven Collaboration with the Power BI app for Microsoft Teams (GA)
value.excerpt: I’m happy to announce that the Power BI App for Microsoft Teams is Generally Available. Learn about the enhancements to the app, how we’re making it easier to deploy it, and how easy it is to get started using data to make better decisions and take better actions.

value.title: More easily integrate goals into all your business processes
value.excerpt: We’re excited to announce new capabilities and improvements for Power BI goals that make it easier than ever to integrate goals into all of your business processes. Learn about the new goals visual, Power Automate integration, goal level permissions, and other experience enhancements.

value.title: Train at your own pace for a career in Big Data with courses on Python, Excel, Power BI and much more
value.excerpt: You can develop the skills required for lucrative data analyst careers while working full-time and without going into debt, even if you have no previous tech experience whatsoever.

value.title: How machine learning speeds up Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Machine learning delivers insights in Power BI reports—and it enables you to get a large amount of data into your reports to generate those insights more quickly.

value.title: Learn the skills to be a data analyst with courses on Python, Excel, Power BI and more
